summary: The Improving Federal Financial Management Act (S.75) aims to modify government-wide financial management practices. It amends Title 31 of the United States Code, particularly focusing on the roles and responsibilities of Chief Financial Officers, the development and implementation of government-wide financial management plans, and agency audits. The bill emphasizes strategic planning, performance measurement, cost-effectiveness, and the integration of performance and cost information. It also promotes transparency by requiring public availability of financial management plans and reports.
